thread.title: Trade Your Clothing, Books and More at Stop N' Swap in Corona
thread.title_full: Trade Your Clothing, Books and More at Stop N' Swap in Corona

title: Trade Your Clothing, Books and More at Stop N' Swap in Corona
text:
Trade Your Clothing, Books and More at Stop N' Swap in Corona By Katie Honan | October 23, 2015 9:03am GrowNYC 
CORONA — Clean out your closets — and fill them with new things — at a swapping event this weekend. 
GrowNYC 's Stop 'N' Swap is headed to P.S. 330 in Corona on Sunday, Oct. 25, from 11 a.m. until 2 p.m. 
Everyone is invited to bring reusable items, including books, toys, clothing and electronics, to swap. 
And you don't have to bring anything to take anything. Just show up with some bags and take what you'd like, organizers said. 
Furniture and other large items are not accepted at the swap. 
The not-for-profit's events are held throughout the city, with the goal of having them in each of the 59 community districts every year. 
“Stop ‘N’ Swaps keep reusable items from ending up in a landfill and prevent the waste that comes from the production, packaging and transportation required to get new things,” said GrowNYC Executive Director Marcel Van Ooyen. 
Whatever is left at the event on Sunday will be donated or recycled. 
P.S. 330 is located at 110-08 Northern Blvd., Corona.
